item.title: Brittany add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Brittany add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Brittany add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Brittany add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Brittany add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books..." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "No medicine cures what happiness cannot." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Brittany add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The future is there... looking back at us. Trying to make sense of the fiction we will have become." -- William Gibson

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description: "You will always be the bread and the knife, not to mention the crystal goblet and—somehow—the wine." -- Billy Collins

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Bohumil Hrabal
item.description: "I pop a beautiful sentence into my mouth and suck it like a fruit drop." -- Bohumil Hrabal

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Hans Christian Andersen
item.description: "But a mermaid has no tears, and therefore she suffers so much more." -- Hans Christian Andersen

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Donald Barthelme
item.description: "The aim of literature ... is the creation of a strange object covered with fur which breaks your heart." -- Donald Barthelme

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Dorothy Allison
item.description: "Two or three things I know for sure, and one of them is the way you can both hate and love something you are not sure you understand." -- Dorothy Allison

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "I'm glad you like adverbs — I adore them; they are the only qualifications I really much respect." -- Henry James

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Charles Chaplin
item.description: "Life is a beautiful magnificent thing, even to a jellyfish." -- Charles Chaplin

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Julie Kagawa
item.description: "Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?" -- Julie Kagawa
